headline: Air Fryer Ravioli
description: These air fryer ravioli make a deliciously crisp, cheesy appetizer or snack; dip them in marinara sauce for a savory treat without the guilt!
name: Air Fryer Ravioli
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup Italian-style bread crumbs (such as Vigo®)
0.25 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
1 (9 ounce) package refrigerated spinach and mozzarella ravioli

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions.

Beat egg and water together in a small bowl. Combine bread crumbs and Pecorino Romano cheese on a plate. Dip 1 ravioli into beaten egg mixture, then into bread crumb mixture, pressing to coat. Place breaded ravioli on a plate and repeat with remaining ravioli. Lightly spray ravioli with cooking spray.
Place as many ravioli in the air fryer basket as you can without overlapping them.

Cook in the preheated air fryer for 6 minutes; flip ravioli using tongs and cook for 4 minutes more. Remove from the air fryer and repeat with remaining ravioli. Serve with your favorite marinara sauce for dipping.

review.reviewBody: Perfection- mine came out puffy and lightly crisp. Thanks for the recipe!
Thank you for this, I added the marinara and some shredded cheese on top, and air fried it for the last 2 min. Turned out really well, will be taking it in my lunches.

I used frozen raviolis and thawed them. They were really hard. Too long to cook, i dont know. They looked really good but swelled up. Will try again with fresh not frozen. Or maybe cook them first, let them cool, then air fry.
I messed it up I think. Going to try again another day

My family enjoyed their fried ravioli. I subbed grated parmesan in for the pricey Romano that is offered at my grocer. It was simple enough that I had my son bread the ravioli and enjoyed a meal that included some time to bond. Do Recommend!
It was sooo easy and the taste was wonderful! Great for happy hour too! DMK

This was my first recipe using my new Nuwave Bravo, which is a combo toaster oven/air fryer. I used my home-made kale/ricotta ravioli, not store bought, and I didn't pre-boil the ravioli. The time and temperature of this recipe worked perfectly to make crisp & crunchy ravioli.
I used mini ravioli’s and the insides got completely dried up. Not sure if regular size would do that, but do not use small raviolis.

I will and have made this again. I found that the time listed was too long for my air fryer. I came close to burning the ravioli the first time. The second time I shortened the time to 4 mins. and it was great. I also found I did not need to turn them. Very good recipe - thanks!
Theses were easy to make and delicious!! The family loved them!!
